title: Awesome List Updates on Oct 21, 2019
_seo_title: Awesome List Updates on Oct 21, 2019 - Track Awesome List

items.title: Awesome Diversity
items.content_text:
### Organizations

*   [Natives in Tech](https://nativesintech.org) - Natives in Tech is a coalition of Native and non-Native software developers whose goal is to support software application development that reinforces Native beliefs, knowledge, and identity.

### Posts

*   [Diversity in Tech](https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/diversity-tech-adam-e-recvlohe/) - By Adam Recvlohe

### Talks

*   [Building Open Source Software that Empowers Native Communities](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AAdrbrYNnPw) - By Adam Recvlohe (@arecvlohe)
items.content_html:
Organizations

  • Natives in Tech - Natives in Tech is a coalition of Native and non-Native software developers whose goal is to support software application development that reinforces Native beliefs, knowledge, and identity.

Posts

  • Diversity in Tech - By Adam Recvlohe

Talks

  • Building Open Source Software that Empowers Native Communities - By Adam Recvlohe (@arecvlohe)

items.title: Awesome React Components
items.content_text:
### Notification

*   [notistack](https://iamhosseindhv.com/notistack) - [demo](https://codesandbox.io/s/github/iamhosseindhv/notistack/tree/master/examples/simple-example??hidenavigation=1\&module=%2FApp.js) - [docs](https://iamhosseindhv.com/notistack/api) - Highly customizable notification snackbars (toasts) that can be stacked on top of each other

### Form Logic / Mouse Events

*   [react-final-form (‚≠ê7.4k)](https://github.com/final-form/react-final-form) - Subscription-based form state management
items.content_html:
Notification

  • notistack - demo - docs - Highly customizable notification snackbars (toasts) that can be stacked on top of each other

Form Logic / Mouse Events

  • react-final-form (‚≠ê7.4k) - Subscription-based form state management

items.title: Awesome Playcanvas
items.content_text:
### Extensions and Utilities

*   [playcanvas-node (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/yushimatenjin/playcanvas-node) - REST API wrapper for Node.js.
*   [tween.js (‚≠ê10k)](https://github.com/tweenjs/tween.js/) - Popular JavaScript tweening library that integrates easily with PlayCanvas.

### Interactive Experiences

*   [Ride Along 2](https://vimeo.com/152996271) - Using WebGL to promote a Hollywood movie release.
*   [Rugby World Cup](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=onOJBCC8R7A) - Promoting the Rugby World Cup in London's Piccadilly Circus.
items.content_html:
Extensions and Utilities

  • playcanvas-node (‚≠ê5) - REST API wrapper for Node.js.
  • tween.js (‚≠ê10k) - Popular JavaScript tweening library that integrates easily with PlayCanvas.

Interactive Experiences

  • Ride Along 2 - Using WebGL to promote a Hollywood movie release.
  • Rugby World Cup - Promoting the Rugby World Cup in London's Piccadilly Circus.

items.title: Awesome Django
items.content_text:
### Resources / Educational

*   [Classy Class-Based Views](https://ccbv.co.uk/) - Detailed descriptions of methods/properties/attributes for each generic class-based view.
*   [Classy Django Forms (‚≠ê30)](https://github.com/ana-balica/classy-django-forms) - Detailed descriptions of methods/properties/attributes for each form class.
*   [Classy Django REST Framework](http://www.cdrf.co) - Detailed descriptions with methods/attributes for DRF class-based views and serializers.

### Resources / Community

*   [Django Users Google Group](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/django-users/) - Very active discussion board for questions/answers.
*   [Developers Google Group](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/django-developers/) - For contributions to Django itself only.

### Resources / Podcasts

*   [Django Chat](https://djangochat.com/) - A weekly podcast from William Vincent and Django Fellow Carlton Gibson with discussions of core Django concepts and regular guests.
*   [Podcast Init](https://www.pythonpodcast.com/) - A popular Python podcast that features Django guests on occasion.

### Hosting / IaaS (Infrastructure-as-a-Service)

*   [Digital Ocean](https://www.digitalocean.com)
*   [Amazon Lightsail](https://aws.amazon.com/lightsail/)

### Projects / Boilerplate

*   [DRFx (‚≠ê491)](https://github.com/wsvincent/drfx/) - A DRF starter with user auth, Pipenv, and other goodies.
*   [django-webpack-starter (‚≠ê59)](https://github.com/khadegd/django-webpack-starter) - Django Webpack starter template for using Webpack 4.

### Projects / Open Source Projects

*   [Blog app with users and forms (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/wsvincent/djangoforbeginners/tree/master/ch7-blog-app-with-users/)
*   [Behavior-Driven Development with Aloe (‚≠ê44)](https://github.com/testdrivenio/django-aloe-bdd/)

### Django REST Framework / DRF Resources

*   [Official Documentation](https://www.django-rest-framework.org/)
*   [awesome-django-rest-framework (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/nioperas06/awesome-django-rest-framework)

### Django REST Framework / DRF Tutorials

*   [DRF with React](https://www.valentinog.com/blog/drf/)
items.content_html:
Resources / Educational

  • Classy Class-Based Views - Detailed descriptions of methods/properties/attributes for each generic class-based view.
  • Classy Django Forms (‚≠ê30) - Detailed descriptions of methods/properties/attributes for each form class.
  • Classy Django REST Framework - Detailed descriptions with methods/attributes for DRF class-based views and serializers.

Resources / Community

  • Django Users Google Group - Very active discussion board for questions/answers.
  • Developers Google Group - For contributions to Django itself only.

Resources / Podcasts

  • Django Chat - A weekly podcast from William Vincent and Django Fellow Carlton Gibson with discussions of core Django concepts and regular guests.
  • Podcast Init - A popular Python podcast that features Django guests on occasion.

Hosting / IaaS (Infrastructure-as-a-Service)

  • Digital Ocean
  • Amazon Lightsail

Projects / Boilerplate

  • DRFx (‚≠ê491) - A DRF starter with user auth, Pipenv, and other goodies.
  • django-webpack-starter (‚≠ê59) - Django Webpack starter template for using Webpack 4.

Projects / Open Source Projects

  • Blog app with users and forms (‚≠ê1.3k)
  • Behavior-Driven Development with Aloe (‚≠ê44)

Django REST Framework / DRF Resources

  • Official Documentation
  • awesome-django-rest-framework (‚≠ê1.4k)

Django REST Framework / DRF Tutorials

  • DRF with React

items.title: Awesome Jmeter
items.content_text:
### CI / Tools & Plugins

*   [JMeter Maven Plugin (‚≠ê432)](https://github.com/jmeter-maven-plugin/jmeter-maven-plugin) - Maven plugin that provides the ability to run JMeter tests as part of the build.

### Distributed Testing / Tutorials & Demo

*   [Setting up a JMeter Cluster for web server load testing](https://www.howtoforge.com/setting-up-jmeter-cluster-for-load-testing/)

### JMeter Performance / Utilities

*   [JMeter Performance](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/jmeter/JMeterPerformance) - JMeter performance evolution across versions.

### Related / Awesome Lists

*   [Awesome Testing (‚≠ê2k)](https://github.com/TheJambo/awesome-testing) - A curated list of testing resources.
items.content_html:
CI / Tools & Plugins

  • JMeter Maven Plugin (‚≠ê432) - Maven plugin that provides the ability to run JMeter tests as part of the build.

Distributed Testing / Tutorials & Demo

  • Setting up a JMeter Cluster for web server load testing

JMeter Performance / Utilities

  • JMeter Performance - JMeter performance evolution across versions.

Related / Awesome Lists

  • Awesome Testing (‚≠ê2k) - A curated list of testing resources.

items.title: Awesome Wordpress Gatsby
items.content_text:
### Written Tutorials / Other helpful Plugins

*   2019.08: [Live Previews with WordPress and Gatsby](https://justinwhall.com/live-previews-with-wordpress-gatsby/) - Tutorial showing how to use the theme‚Äôs higher order component to facilitate previews for WordPress posts and custom post types.
*   2019.08: [Gatsby with WPGraphQL, ACF and Gatbsy-Image](https://dev.to/nevernull/gatsby-with-wpgraphql-acf-and-gatbsy-image-72m) - A guide, that shows how to implement gatsby-image, so it can be used for WordPress media files.

### Video Tutorials / Other helpful Plugins

*   2019.07: [Gatsby + WordPress with WPGraphQL (with Jason Bahl) ‚Äî Learn With Jason](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DH7I1xRrbxs) - In this stream, Jason Bahl teaches how to use WordPress with Advanced Custom Fields and WPGraphQL to create an powerful, flexible admin dashboard, then query and display that data in a Gatsby site.
*   2019.06: [Using WordPress with WPGraphQL](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aqEfEuVWqws) - In this video you will learn how to use GraphQL with WordPress using an awesome plugin named WPGraphQL and some extra cool stuff like GraphQL + Advanced Custom Fields.
*   2019.04: [WPGraphQL for ACF](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rIg4MHc8elg) - Jason Bahl shows how to use WPGraphQL for Advanced Custom Fields.
*   2018.07: [GraphQL with WordPress and Gutenberg - Jason Bahl - 2018 JavaScript for WordPress Conference
    ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6CuM1PY9ESQ) - In this talk from the 2018 JavaScript for WordPress Conference, the Developer of the WP GraphQL Plugin, Jason Bahl, gives updated examples of how you can use GraphQL with WordPress and Gutenberg.

### Starters / Other helpful Plugins

*   [Gatsby + WPGraphQL Blog Example (‚≠ê147)](https://github.com/wp-graphql/gatsby-wpgraphql-blog-example) - Demo showing how to use WPGraphQL as the source for Gatsby Sites.
*   [Gatsby + Headless WordPress + Netlify Starter (‚≠ê213)](https://github.com/justinwhall/gatsby-wordpress-netlify-starter) - A Gatsby + WordPress starter for continuous deployment to Netlify.

### Themes / Other helpful Plugins

*   [Twenty Nineteen Gatsby Theme (‚≠ê69)](https://github.com/zgordon/twentynineteen-gatsby-theme) - A port of the Twenty Nineteen WordPress Theme over to Gatsby.
*   [Gatsby WordPress Publisher Theme
     (‚≠ê31)](https://github.com/staticfuse/gatsby-theme-publisher) - The Gatsby Publisher Theme allows you to create a headless (or decoupled) WordPress site. This theme will display all of your pages and posts in a static front-end built on React and Gatsby.
items.content_html:
Written Tutorials / Other helpful Plugins

  • 2019.08: Live Previews with WordPress and Gatsby - Tutorial showing how to use the theme‚Äôs higher order component to facilitate previews for WordPress posts and custom post types.
  • 2019.08: Gatsby with WPGraphQL, ACF and Gatbsy-Image - A guide, that shows how to implement gatsby-image, so it can be used for WordPress media files.

Video Tutorials / Other helpful Plugins

  • 2019.07: Gatsby + WordPress with WPGraphQL (with Jason Bahl) ‚Äî Learn With Jason - In this stream, Jason Bahl teaches how to use WordPress with Advanced Custom Fields and WPGraphQL to create an powerful, flexible admin dashboard, then query and display that data in a Gatsby site.
  • 2019.06: Using WordPress with WPGraphQL - In this video you will learn how to use GraphQL with WordPress using an awesome plugin named WPGraphQL and some extra cool stuff like GraphQL + Advanced Custom Fields.
  • 2019.04: WPGraphQL for ACF - Jason Bahl shows how to use WPGraphQL for Advanced Custom Fields.
  • 2018.07: GraphQL with WordPress and Gutenberg - Jason Bahl - 2018 JavaScript for WordPress Conference - In this talk from the 2018 JavaScript for WordPress Conference, the Developer of the WP GraphQL Plugin, Jason Bahl, gives updated examples of how you can use GraphQL with WordPress and Gutenberg.

Starters / Other helpful Plugins

  • Gatsby + WPGraphQL Blog Example (‚≠ê147) - Demo showing how to use WPGraphQL as the source for Gatsby Sites.
  • Gatsby + Headless WordPress + Netlify Starter (‚≠ê213) - A Gatsby + WordPress starter for continuous deployment to Netlify.

Themes / Other helpful Plugins

  • Twenty Nineteen Gatsby Theme (‚≠ê69) - A port of the Twenty Nineteen WordPress Theme over to Gatsby.
  • Gatsby WordPress Publisher Theme (‚≠ê31) - The Gatsby Publisher Theme allows you to create a headless (or decoupled) WordPress site. This theme will display all of your pages and posts in a static front-end built on React and Gatsby.

items.title: Awesome Robotic Tooling
items.content_text:
### Development Environment / Code and Run

*   [ROS IDEs](http://wiki.ros.org/IDEs) - This page collects experience and advice on using integrated development environments (IDEs) with ROS.

### Development Environment / Unit and Integration Test

*   [UnitTesting](https://wiki.ros.org/Quality/Tutorials/UnitTesting) - This page lays out the rationale, best practices, and policies for writing and running unit tests and integration tests for ROS.

items.title: Awesome Android
items.content_text:
### Chat & Messaging / ORM

*   [Stream Chat](https://getstream.io/tutorials/android-chat/) - Comprehensive SDK & Components for real-time chat, powered by [Stream](https://getstream.io/chat/).

### Podcasts / Custom Dialog

*   [Talking Kotlin](https://talkingkotlin.com/) - A Podcast on Kotlin and more.
*   [Android Authority](https://www.androidauthority.com/podcast/) is a weekly Android podcast hosted by Adam Doud, Joe Hindy, and Jonathan Feist from the Android Authority team.

items.title: Awesome Clean Tech
items.content_text:
### Companies / Water

*   [The great bubble barrier](https://thegreatbubblebarrier.com) | Netherlands | 2016

    Developed a system working with a tube with holes placed on the bottom of a river. Pumping air through the tube creates a bubble barrier, or air curtain. The air bubbles force plastics in the water to the surface, making them accessible for removal.

### Companies / Social Impact

*   [Billions in Change](https://billionsinchange.com/) | USA | 2015

    Billions in Change develops and delivers inventions that help the unlucky half of the world obtain basic needs like clean water, reliable electricity, and sufficient food. Those fundamentals set the foundation for education, health, and livelihood, enabling people to improve life for themselves and for their families.
items.content_html:
Companies / Water

  • The great bubble barrier | Netherlands | 2016

    Developed a system working with a tube with holes placed on the bottom of a river. Pumping air through the tube creates a bubble barrier, or air curtain. The air bubbles force plastics in the water to the surface, making them accessible for removal.

Companies / Social Impact

  • Billions in Change | USA | 2015

    Billions in Change develops and delivers inventions that help the unlucky half of the world obtain basic needs like clean water, reliable electricity, and sufficient food. Those fundamentals set the foundation for education, health, and livelihood, enabling people to improve life for themselves and for their families.

items.title: Awesome Vapor
items.content_text:
### Libraries

*   ![v3](https://github.com/vapor-community/awesome-vapor/raw/main/img/vapor-3.png) [Bugsnag (‚≠ê39)](https://github.com/nodes-vapor/bugsnag) ‚Äì Report errors with Bugsnag.
*   ![v3](https://github.com/vapor-community/awesome-vapor/raw/main/img/vapor-3.png) [Flash (‚≠ê37)](https://github.com/nodes-vapor/flash) ‚Äì Flash messages between views.
*   ![v3](https://github.com/vapor-community/awesome-vapor/raw/main/img/vapor-3.png) [Gatekeeper (‚≠ê75)](https://github.com/nodes-vapor/gatekeeper) ‚Äì Rate limiting middleware for Vapor.
*   ![v3](https://github.com/vapor-community/awesome-vapor/raw/main/img/vapor-3.png) [JWT Keychain (‚≠ê40)](https://github.com/nodes-vapor/jwt-keychain) ‚Äì Easily scaffold a keychain using JWT for Vapor.
*   ![v3](https://github.com/vapor-community/awesome-vapor/raw/main/img/vapor-3.png) [Leaf Markdown (‚≠ê62)](https://github.com/vapor-community/leaf-markdown) ‚Äì Markdown renderer for Vapor.
*   ![v3](https://github.com/vapor-community/awesome-vapor/raw/main/img/vapor-3.png) [Lingo Vapor (‚≠ê57)](https://github.com/vapor-community/Lingo-Vapor) ‚Äì Vapor provider for Lingo ‚Äì the Swift localization library.
*   ![v3](https://github.com/vapor-community/awesome-vapor/raw/main/img/vapor-3.png) [Meow (‚≠ê66)](https://github.com/OpenKitten/Meow) ‚Äì An alternative codable ORM for MongoDB.
*   ![v3](https://github.com/vapor-community/awesome-vapor/raw/main/img/vapor-3.png) [MongoKitten (‚≠ê744)](https://github.com/OpenKitten/MongoKitten) ‚Äì MongoDB driver in Swift.
*   ![v3](https://github.com/vapor-community/awesome-vapor/raw/main/img/vapor-3.png) [Paginator (‚≠ê71)](https://github.com/nodes-vapor/paginator) ‚Äì Query pagination for Vapor and Fluent.
*   ![v3](https://github.com/vapor-community/awesome-vapor/raw/main/img/vapor-3.png) [Sanitize (‚≠ê17)](https://github.com/gperdomor/sanitize) ‚Äì Powerful model extraction from Vapor JSON requests.
*   ![v3](https://github.com/vapor-community/awesome-vapor/raw/main/img/vapor-3.png) [SendGrid Provider (‚≠ê77)](https://github.com/vapor-community/sendgrid-provider) ‚Äì SendGrid-powered mail backend for Vapor.
*   ![v3](https://github.com/vapor-community/awesome-vapor/raw/main/img/vapor-3.png) [Slugify (‚≠ê17)](https://github.com/nodes-vapor/slugify) ‚Äì Convenience for sluggifying your strings.
*   ![v3](https://github.com/vapor-community/awesome-vapor/raw/main/img/vapor-3.png) [Storage (‚≠ê66)](https://github.com/nodes-vapor/storage) ‚Äì Eases the use of multiple storage and CDN services.
*   ![v3](https://github.com/vapor-community/awesome-vapor/raw/main/img/vapor-3.png) [Stripe Provider (‚≠ê182)](https://github.com/vapor-community/stripe-provider) ‚Äì Stripe Provider for Vapor.
*   ![v3](https://github.com/vapor-community/awesome-vapor/raw/main/img/vapor-3.png) [Sugar (‚≠ê28)](https://github.com/nodes-vapor/sugar) ‚Äì A package of sugar for Vapor.
*   ![v3](https://github.com/vapor-community/awesome-vapor/raw/main/img/vapor-3.png) [SwiftyBeaver Provider (‚≠ê33)](https://github.com/vapor-community/swiftybeaver-provider) ‚Äì SwiftyBeaver Logging Provider for Vapor, the server-side Swift web framework.
*   ![v3](https://github.com/vapor-community/awesome-vapor/raw/main/img/vapor-3.png) [Telesign Provider (‚≠ê10)](https://github.com/vapor-community/telesign-provider) ‚Äì A Telesign provider for Vapor.
*   ![v3](https://github.com/vapor-community/awesome-vapor/raw/main/img/vapor-3.png) [Vapor Security Headers (‚≠ê150)](https://github.com/brokenhandsio/VaporSecurityHeaders) ‚Äì Harden Your Security Headers For Vapor.

### Education / Articles

*   ![v4](https://github.com/vapor-community/awesome-vapor/raw/main/img/vapor-4.png) [What‚Äôs new in Vapor 4?](https://theswiftdev.com/2019/08/26/whats-new-in-vapor-4/)

### Open-source Projects / Videos

*   ![v3](https://github.com/vapor-community/awesome-vapor/raw/main/img/vapor-3.png) [SteamPress (‚≠ê376)](https://github.com/brokenhandsio/SteamPress) ‚Äì A Blogging Engine and Platform written in Swift for use with the Vapor Framework.
items.content_html:
Libraries

  • Bugsnag (‚≠ê39) ‚Äì Report errors with Bugsnag.
  • Flash (‚≠ê37) ‚Äì Flash messages between views.
  • Gatekeeper (‚≠ê75) ‚Äì Rate limiting middleware for Vapor.
  • JWT Keychain (‚≠ê40) ‚Äì Easily scaffold a keychain using JWT for Vapor.
  • Leaf Markdown (‚≠ê62) ‚Äì Markdown renderer for Vapor.
  • Lingo Vapor (‚≠ê57) ‚Äì Vapor provider for Lingo ‚Äì the Swift localization library.
  • Meow (‚≠ê66) ‚Äì An alternative codable ORM for MongoDB.
  • MongoKitten (‚≠ê744) ‚Äì MongoDB driver in Swift.
  • Paginator (‚≠ê71) ‚Äì Query pagination for Vapor and Fluent.
  • Sanitize (‚≠ê17) ‚Äì Powerful model extraction from Vapor JSON requests.
  • SendGrid Provider (‚≠ê77) ‚Äì SendGrid-powered mail backend for Vapor.
  • Slugify (‚≠ê17) ‚Äì Convenience for sluggifying your strings.
  • Storage (‚≠ê66) ‚Äì Eases the use of multiple storage and CDN services.
  • Stripe Provider (‚≠ê182) ‚Äì Stripe Provider for Vapor.
  • Sugar (‚≠ê28) ‚Äì A package of sugar for Vapor.
  • SwiftyBeaver Provider (‚≠ê33) ‚Äì SwiftyBeaver Logging Provider for Vapor, the server-side Swift web framework.
  • Telesign Provider (‚≠ê10) ‚Äì A Telesign provider for Vapor.
  • Vapor Security Headers (‚≠ê150) ‚Äì Harden Your Security Headers For Vapor.

Education / Articles

  • What‚Äôs new in Vapor 4?

Open-source Projects / Videos

  • SteamPress (‚≠ê376) ‚Äì A Blogging Engine and Platform written in Swift for use with the Vapor Framework.
